profile_positions.title: AI Community Manager/ ELLIS Unit Amsterdam Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
The GreenNet Project- the sustainability community kit - intends to propel a fostering culture of initiatives to further the university's sustainability agenda and make an actual impact. It has a variety of angles; Green Corner, Sustainability Features, Communication Strategy, and Policy suggestion. 

My roles include the following: 
•	Designed implementation strategy of the sustainability community kit
•	Organized resources, and communication as well as coordination with different stakeholders of the project
•	Implement the prototype developed within the timeframe, including web features development, content collection
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
abl is a one-stop online consulting platform where sustainability consultants create meaningful and direct connections with practitioners in need of sustainable solutions. We aim to promote invaluable practical knowledge to make sustainability an integrated part of life. Currently, abl is still at the initial development stage.

abl sustainable is supported by Novel-T incubator through the ADVANCED program.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
The Digital Society School is a part of the Faculty of Digital Media and Creative Industries of the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. 

The Systems for Sharing Track of the Digital Transformation Traineeship works on technical, digital and social systems by creating proof of concepts, prototypes and do applied research to support ’systems for sharing’ in the light of the UN Sustainable Development Goals. The track also trains organisations and professionals to adopt a different mindset and be able to stimulate a sharing culture within their work environment or community.
profile_positions.title: Digital Transformation (Sustainable Development) Trainee/ Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My roles include, as follows: 
-	Design innovative sustainability projects for Indonesia, which includes renewable energy and waste management, by conducting researches and analyses; 
-	Create communication materials in promoting sustainability, including brochure, and presentation; 
-	Engage with relevant stakeholders, including government, private sectors, and partner organizations, to explore potential collaboration; 
-	Develop and implement PMO strategy in navigating the newly established PMO function of the WSF. 

Since the foundation in 2011, WSF as a Sustainability NGO based in The Hague, the Netherlands has served communities and organizations with in-depth analysis, research, and execution of sustainable strategies around the world.  

Now at the confluence of an unprecedented global pandemic, economic downturn, and erratic climate patterns, we have made the restructuring and the relaunch of WSF a priority for higher impact, and more tangible and effective outcomes in tackling the emerging challenges of our time. 

At a glance: WSF Overview
- A United Nations Environmental Program (UNEP) Accredited NGO
- A Member of U.N. Sustainable Development Steering Committee Rule of law and Governance
- A Member of U.N. Global Compact with U.N. ECOSOC registration with Stichting Bronning Fonds
- A Partner of NATO CIMIC Common Effort Capacity Building and Humanitarian Aid
- An NGO Member of Peaceoneday.org
- A Member of sdgcharter.nl
- International co-operation to develop and execute on high impact WSF Country Programs

profile_positions.description:
I supported daily works of Human Resources Division, among others, on recruitment activities, and organisation of meetings/ events in regard to human resources recruitment and development.

The Association of Southeast Asian Nations, or ASEAN, was established on 8 August 1967 in Bangkok, Thailand, with the signing of the ASEAN Declaration (Bangkok Declaration) by the Founding Fathers of ASEAN, namely Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Brunei Darussalam then joined on 7 January 1984, Viet Nam on 28 July 1995, Lao PDR and Myanmar on 23 July 1997, and Cambodia on 30 April 1999, making up what is today the ten Member States of ASEAN.

volunteer_experiences.role: ANU Indonesia Project- Indonesia Update 2014 Conference Support
volunteer_experiences.description:
ANU Indonesia Project is a leading international centre of research and graduate training on the society and economy of Indonesia. For over 50 years it has been at the forefront of Indonesian studies in Australia and worldwide.

The Project was established in 1965 by H.W. Arndt in response to profound changes in the Indonesian economic and political landscape. Initially comprising a small group of Indonesia-focused economists, it has since grown into an interdisciplinary research centre. Researching economic change is still at its heart, but the Project now brings together academics, students, policymakers and leaders from a range of disciplines and countries to discuss the multitude of issues in Indonesia’s growth and development.

The Project has helped build greater understanding between Indonesia and Australia and fostered important relations between Indonesian and Australian scholars, students and policymakers.

volunteer_experiences.role: Research and Student Activism Division of Indonesian Students Association (PPIA/ISA) ACT
volunteer_experiences.description: ISA/PPIA ACT is a branch of Indonesian student affiliation  based in Canberra, the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) State. This organisation consists of two sub-branches which are Australian National University ISA/PPIA and University of Canberra  ISA/PPIA.

company.name: The Food Co-op Shop and Cafe

volunteer_experiences.description: The Food Co-op began its life as the ANU Nutrition Society back in 1976. Members own the Co-op, share the benefits of it and have the opportunity to work in it. The Co-op is managed with consensus-based decision making and all members are invited to participate. The Co-op employs two part time managers. Members act as volunteer co-ordinators staffing the store, and perform the other tasks required to keep the Co-op operating.

The ANU Counselling Centre promotes, supports and enhances mental health and wellbeing within the University student community.  ANU Counselling Centre is a free, confidential and non-diagnostic service available to all currently enrolled ANU students.

volunteer_experiences.role: Alumni Empowerment Division Member of Alumni Association- Indonesia
volunteer_experiences.description:
APU Indonesia (APUINA) Alumni commits to build our network and connection through annual gatherings and other networking events with the aim to support the development of career and education for our member. 

The Alumni Empowerment Division organises various activities, including talks and workshops, to develop knowledge, skills and networks of alumni of the Ritsumeikan of Asia Pacific University based in Indonesia.

Creating financial stability for people with mental health issues, and promoting awareness on the importance of mental health, through community engagement and development, art therapy and social media campaign.

Since 2017, TFP have been conducting art therapies in two social and mental disabilities organisations based in Bekasi, West Java, Indonesia, with the total number of patients of approximately 450 people. These therapies mainly consist of simple and therapeutic drawing and colouring activities which we believe could help release stress and improve mental health of the patients  of these organisations. 

https://buset-online.com/disabilitas-mental-the-forgotten-people/
Instagram account: @theforgottenpeople_id

Hoshizora helps to finance education of rural children in Indonesia. 

I was in charge of the One Round Program and Fun Day Project Leader. I was actively involved in fundraising program and on-campus Hoshizora campaigns.

APU INA is the Indonesian community, The Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University
